newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves via two-day fixed system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves via two-day fixed system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York added temporary reserves to the U.S. banking system on Tuesday via two-day fixed system repurchase agreements, a Fed spokesman said.
Most Wall Street pundits expected the Fed to stay out of the market. But the analysts said the Fed's move on Tuesday had no monetary policy implications.
At 1130 EDT/1530 GMT, the time when the Fed usually intervenes in the market, federal funds were trading at 5-3/16 percent, below the central bank's 5-1/4 percent target.
